segmentosSRT.text: The newspaper "Correo Nacional",
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: published in Bogotá on March 6th, 1906,
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: the exact and vivid account of the execution of four men
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: for the attempt of murder of the General Rafael Reyes,
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: by that time president of Colombia.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: Marco Arturo Salgar, Carlos Roberto Gonzalez, Juan Ortiz and Fernando Aguilar.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: were the four men sentenced to death, and in consequence
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: shot in the same place where they committed the crime.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: The account, whose author's name remains unknown,
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: is extremely detailed.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: For example, he describes one by one the kind of hat that each condemned was wearing.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: It’s worth quoting the whole fragment:
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: The reporter also collects a series of interviews.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: The most striking is perhaps, the one from the Captain of Executions, who just says,
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: in a serious tone I'd guess: "Nothing is sacred".
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: The reporter states: "The shooting proceeds as normal.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: Given the signal with his sword by the Captain of Executions,
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: the first round of shooting resounds from the rifles.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: and give the order for a second shooting,
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: which ends with the immediate entrance of the four coffins
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: to transport the corpses to the cemetery."
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: This time, the event is more relevant than usually, since president Rafael Reyes
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: guided by this moment of political instability, makes an exception
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: and the shooting doesn't take place in the courtyard of the School of Infantry,
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: where it would normally happened.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: Instead, it's held in a public area, in front of over 10,000 people.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: Rafael Reyes saw here the remains of the last civil war
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: that had ended only four years ago, and still had the country in agony.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: Shooting people of his same political party in public areas,
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: was for him a sign of authority,
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: but also an invitation to end the traditional divide
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: between the liberal and the conservative party.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: With the purpose of making this shooting visible to as many people as possible
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: Reyes publishes the book "February 10th", telling the events through photos.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: Reyes thought that, just like the people who witnessed the shooting in person did,
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: everyone who saw those photos would immediately support his idea.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: Nevertheless, the most interesting part of this series of photos
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: happens after the moment of the cemetery picture.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: It’s unknown whose idea it was, but due to the impact caused by the pictures of the execution
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: president Rafael Reyes, Chief of police Pedro Pedraza, and photographer Lino Lara
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: decided together to recreate the moments before the shooting.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: They decided to recreate the attack on the president
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: and the capture of the condemned, to create a story.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: The outcome was what the historians called a "false document".
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: From the 22 pictures that make up the story, 18 are theatrical reenactments.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: This is the first time of a tale made through photographs in Colombia.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: This little narrative gesture, is acknowledged by tradition
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: as the beginning of filmmaking in the country.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: Here lays the body of Rafael Reyes today.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: This was going to be a movie about the beginnings of Cinema in Colombia,
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: about its first images.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: But as it's being said:
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: To talk about Colombia we have to talk about war.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: And to talk about war we need to talk about armies, about deaths, about cemeteries.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: At the same time, my house and my parents house looked like a cemetery.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: It felt like haunted by an inert current, like flooded by murky water
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: or better, by dead water.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: A few months ago my mother had an episode of mutism,
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: and without any explanation, she just stopped talking.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: I remember with some nostalgia
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: how she repeated the words of that Mexican musician while cooking:
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: that said something like: "I wish you to be happy, very happy...
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: I wish you to find love, because you deserve it"
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: I read somewhere that the first thing you forget about a person is the voice.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: Affected by this familiar incident,
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: and because of what connects all things together
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: maybe the first moments of national cinema
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: and the muteness of my mother can be part of the same scenario.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: Like when you look at a surface where shadows are being projected
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: and you can't tell each object from the other apart.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: One night my father woke up and saw the light of the bathroom on.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: When he came closer, he saw my mother in front of the mirror, shaking.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: My father hugged her and asked her what was going on,
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: he asked her if she had a bad dream
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: but she couldn’t answer.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: Since that moment, she has never spoken again.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: My mother spent most of the time locked in a room looking at people through the window.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: Her presence had become more and more unbearable for my father
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: who couldn’t avoid feeling sometimes guilty, and sometimes cheated.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: The ambiguity of the doctors answers left a bad feeling behind
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: which made him think that she was just pretending.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: One day, a worker of the family suggested to try with another type of specialist
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: from his point of view, my mother's muteness was due to a powerful spell.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: My father agreed, even if it would make him feel humiliated
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: because for him, superstitions were for fools.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: After two weeks some kind of chaman or warlock came to my mother.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: After wandering around the house, where some kind of weird mantle could certainly be felt
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: like a thick, rancid smell, he told my father:
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: "Your problems have a solution, don’t worry.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: You just have to sell this house,
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: and leave somewhere visible a valuable object and a picture of her."
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: My father did so.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: The house was put on sale, and on a shelf he left a picture of her
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: and a black stone that she held like a luck charm.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: There’s an announcement on the internet that says:
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: "Recover all important moments of your life that are kept in old tapes.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: Live those unique moments with your family and friends again.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: All formats, Betacam SP, VHS, DV, mini DV, 8mm…"
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: I contacted the advertiser.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: That same afternoon, in a country house on the outskirts of the city,
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: I got to meet Carlos Pelbet,
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: founder of an old audiovisual company that he and his brother had
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: since the beginning of the 80s.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: Carlos told me rapidly about his interest in films
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: or rather, he told me that at some point of his life it was of his interest.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: Also that Pelbet, his company,
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: inaugurated the recording and broadcasting business of soccer matches in Colombia
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: and that it was right then, when competing with the big TV channels, that the company broke.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: He told me that a few years ago he started collecting anonymous family home movies
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: from the cassettes that he digitizes. Hours and hours of family events
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: weddings, first communions, birthdays, baptisms, Christmas and holidays.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: In a sense, my film is a relative of all these images,
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: of the personal images of everyday rites.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: Carlos tells me that each week, a different youngster arrives at his door
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: wanting to digitize images of his family
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: with an idea similar to mine:
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: To make a film about their mothers, fathers or grandparents.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: Apparently more people are doing the same film as me at this moment.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: We are all thinking about the same images.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: These are some images taken by my mother.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: A movie about a play in a rural school she worked at.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: Back then, she sympathized with the insurgent groups of the country.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: That’s me.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: In one of the movie cans, it was written on a white tape:
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: "Marquetalia, 1964".
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: Those are the place and the date where the famous FARC was founded.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: Apparently, the play is about a popular narration about the first combats
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: between the FARC guerilla and the National Army.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: The story is the following:
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: Having the intention of avoiding the expansion of the communist guerrilla,
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: on May 18th, 1964 president Guillermo León Valencia
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: sends over a thousand soldiers to the Tolima plateau
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: in search for a suspected FARC camp with 48 members of the insurgent movement in it.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: After nine days of intense wandering, the group of soldiers,
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: lead by Lieutenant Colonel José Joaquín Matallana,
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: starts suspecting that they’re wrong, that there’s no such camp.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: They quickly realize that the insurgents are not full time soldiers,
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: and that most of them actually
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: have a disguised life as farmers among the civilians.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: A question immediately arose:
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: How to tell the population, most of them farmers, from the guerrillas apart?
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: Facing this, Colonel José Joaquín Matallana,
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: who considered himself as an analytic and methodic person
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: and an innovating strategist, thought to have the answer.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: He explains to his soldiers: "This problem is essentially about appearances".
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: Matallana ordered his soldiers to go after every man and woman of the area
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: and force them to wear the guerrilla uniform in front of them.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: Matallana assured his soldiers,
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: that the uniform had the strength and essential capacity
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: to reveal someone's identity.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: According to his logic, wearing the uniform
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: would immediately reveal if the person was a real guerilla soldier or not.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: After two weeks they had captured 52 people, including five children and eight elderly.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: This idea would be known later as the Matallana logic.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: And what could have been a brilliant military operation,
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: ended up being one of the biggest political failures in history
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: because, in less than two years, those 48 soldiers would later turn into five thousand.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: From then on, the idea of the disguised guerrilla would become an obsession
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: in the development of public opinion in the country.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: Throughout the years, the question would be incessantly repeated:
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: Who’s really from the guerilla, and who’s not?
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: More than 20 years ago my mother filmed me.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: Today, I’m filming her.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: Seeing myself in that play, playing role of a farmer
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: captured by the army and forced to dress like a guerilla man
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: I couldn’t avoid thinking of the recent events of the war in Colombia.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: Thousands of innocent young people were captured by the National Army of Colombia
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: and taken to different parts of the country to be murdered later.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: Then, their bodies were dressed up like guerilla-soldier
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: and presented in front of the media like military successes.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: It was a systematic falsification of war events.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: Stagings, using real victims to create a story.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: By the year 2008, this practice was so common in the National Army
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: that the victims of this type of crime counted to the present day
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: are more than the missing people during the dictatorship in Chile.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: During the 1960s,
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: in search of images of true revolutionaries,
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: two French filmmakers travelled to Riochiquito,
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: located in the north of the province of Cauca.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: They recorded there the activities of the recently founded FARC.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: According to a French article called "Cinema declares war on us"
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: the screening of this movie
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: generated an unexpected anguish among young people in Paris.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: Apparently, proving the existence of revolutionary life
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: radically buried any other alternative of life.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: For the young Parisians of that time
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: nothing could be compared to the idea of leading a life in the armed struggle
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: for political transformation.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: Hence, the movie made them feel
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: that their lives and experiences were insignificant
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: compared to those of Colombian guerilla.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: Louise Canet, a western movies director,
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: then recently joined to the French Socialist Party
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: declared after watching the movie:
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: "It’s common to hear people saying that South American people are violent by nature
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: that they have a violent heritage from the Spanish and the Indigenous people.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: I don’t know what to think. But I’m sure of something:
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: It’s a fertile land for rebels".
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: This is the place where the attempt against president Rafael Reyes happened
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: and where the four men who did it were shot later on.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: In the same place, just a few weeks later, photographer Lino Lara
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: and Commandant Pedro Pedraza recreated the attempt of murder.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: According to the records of the Correo Nacional,
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: the pictures were taken in two days
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: and only during morning hours.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: From those two days, a brief correspondence between Lino Lara
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: and General Pedro Pedraza hast been preserved.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: Here, after making it clear that he’s also a photographer
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: and not a superstitious person, officer Pedraza asks himself:
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: is there any risk in imitating the dead?
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: There is no known answer from Lino Lara to this question.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: In fact, very little is known about him.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: In contrast, a lot has been written about these photographs
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: and the importance of violent events reenactments in the country.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: It's easy to think that the idea of this first tale has been influenced
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: by some of the first films of Thomas Alva Edison
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: in which episodes of famous executions are recreated.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: For example: Here they recreate the death of Leon Czolgosz
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: a Polish anarchist sentenced to death for the murder of the president of the United States,
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: William McKinley, on September the 6th, 1901.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: Edison's goal was to publicize the electric chair
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: to make it the new method of execution in the country and replace the gallows.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: He knew that neither technology, nor his inventions were neutral
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: and since electricity could be turned into a killing device
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: the cinematograph and the pictures
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: could also unleash very useful energies for the project of a country.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: These landscapes of the Magdalena river
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: were recorded in photographs by Rafael Reyes in 1909.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: Back then, the former president dedicated himself to travel around the unknown national territory
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: thinking about how Colombian cinema could be used according to the project of a country.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: The result of this 22-day-long adventure was a book called:
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: "Presidential excursions, notes from a travel journal."

segmentosSRT.text: For instance:

segmentosSRT.text: especially in the areas of banana plantations.

segmentosSRT.text: Therefore, articles from French and English magazines

segmentosSRT.text: recommending the consumption of bananas were included

segmentosSRT.text: arguing that bananas were the most hygienic and nutritious fruit of them all.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: At the same time, this documentation is accompanied by a series of photographs
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: that privilege images of landscapes, agricultural colonies, train tracks

segmentosSRT.text: prominent personalities of the industrial world and workers.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: This book was the first visual record of the national territory.

segmentosSRT.text: Rafael Reyes described it as an "explained cinematograph".
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: Banana field blueprint
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: The truth was, Rafael Reyes did not only intend to create a catalog of wealths
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: to allure foreign multinationals.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: His true purpose was to create a unified image of the country,
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: which due to the characteristics of its geography
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: suffered from a great lack of communication among its regions
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: which by the time was already producing great losses in large portions of the territory.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: Rafael Reyes was looking for something a little more elusive and much more dangerous.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: He was sure that all people of the country should be united by something,
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: a supposed "national essence" that would prevent their dismemberment.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: He asked himself: What are we?
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: The result of a discrete genocide?
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: Or are we the occasional guardians of infinite clusters of gold
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: and immense expanses of water that turn into fruits?
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: Driven by the scientific spirit of the time
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: Reyes saw in the photographic device the best tool to look for that essence.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: He thought: If photographs can capture, better than anything else in the world
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: the outstanding feature of the identity of a subject that is, of course, his face
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: why wouldn’t it be able, with enough effort,
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: to reveal the image of the true face of these lands and thus, its identity?
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07

segmentosSRT.text: A group of the right images can unify the country.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_07
